column2: ENGLISH

Whether through war or just the slow passage of time, the population in this province has fallen. Such is the fate of all elves in Ulthuan, to slowly diminish, but they will never yield to their enemies even so.

Whether through war or just the slow passage of time, the population in this province is now moderately depopulated. Empty villages and mansions dot the country side, their former inhabitants now only a distant memory.

Whether through war or just the slow passage of time, the population in this province is now heavily depopulated. The lords there struggle to maintain a semblance of civilization, and many areas are now devoid of elves entirely, given over to nature and the wild beasts.

Whether through war or just the slow passage of time, the population in this province is now severely depopulated. The major noble families still maintain their mansions and the immediate surrounds, but they have lost the ability to control much more than that.
This province is occupied by enemies and many precious elven lives have been lost.
I could have done just as well.
While on a border patrol, one of your courtiers defeated a band of raiders, almost single-handedly driving them off. [From.GetSheHeCap] is hailed as a great warrior by all in the court.

While on a border patrol, a courtier's small force was ambushed, but [From.GetSheHe] fled and left [From.GetHerHis] men to die! [From.GetHerHisCap] name is in disgrace, and [From.GetSheHe] has shamed our entire court with [From.GetHerHis] cowardice.
It reminds me of the first light of a winter moon!
It reminds me of the first light of a winter moon!

This courtier has composed a stunning new epic, which brings tears to the eyes of anyone who hears it. At the feast table, even hardened warriors are seen with misty eyes, reminiscing of the glories of your ancient race.
No, I think I'll sit this one out.

Foul creatures such as manticores and hydras sometimes make their way down from the Anulii mountains. Your huntmaster is arranging a great hunt, do you wish to join in it and perhaps win a new trophy for the walls of your feast hall?
Who am I to go against tradition?

While the Phoenix King is the political centre of Ulthuan, the Everqueen is its spiritual heart. It is tradition that they have a year-long ritual marriage and produce a daughter who shall be the next Everqueen.
Who am I to stand against tradition?

While the Phoenix King is the political centre of Ulthuan, the Everqueen is its spiritual heart. It is tradition that they have a year-long ritual marriage and produce a daughter who shall be the next Everqueen.
Dear wife, I thought of Ulthuan the whole time!
You travel swiftly to Avelorn, where you spend many days and nights with the Everqueen. She assures you that her magic will guarantee that a child will be born shortly - the new future Everqueen.
I knew it was going to be a girl!
Nine months after the visit from the Phoenix King, a child is born. Avelorn rejoices at the birth of its future Everqueen!
She will be a great Everqueen one day.
Word reaches you that all of Avelorn and Ulthuan rejoice - a new Everqueen has been born, you have fathered a beautiful daughter!
Passing the Flames
It is tradition for the Phoenix King to be legitimized by crossing Asuryan's holy flames. If the Prince emerges unscathed, then he is recognized as the rightful ruler of the Asur.
The priestesses make sure you are ready by casting the proper protective spells, and you leap into the flames that will consecrate you as the rightful ruler of Ulthuan.
May Asuryan judge me well.
You emerge unscathed from the holy flames, the priestesses raise their praises to the Gods and the new Phoenix King.
Asuryan blesses me.

You enter the flames with a steady heart, but the Gods do not favour you today. Asuryan's gaze passes through your protective spells and your flesh is scourged with fire. The priestesses manage to recover you, shrieking and maimed, but the will of the Gods has been made clear today, you are not the rightful heir to the Phoenix Crown.
AAAARGH!

You enter the flames with a steady heart, but the Gods do not favour you today. Asuryan's gaze passes through your protective spells and your flesh is scourged with fire. The priestesses struggle to save you, but your offences must have been great indeed, for they recover nothing but a blackened carcass.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has passed through the Flames of Asuryan without being burned, thus proving his divinely-given right to rule over Ulthuan.
Long live the Phoenix King!
What a weird custom.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] tried to pass through the Flames of Asuryan, but the god saw his wickedness and burned him, sculpting a blasphemous shape around a blasphemous heart.
He cannot wear the crown!
He was burned for crossing a fire. So what?
Your [GetFromRelation] was burned by the holy Flames of Asuryan, disgracing his whole line along with himself.
But I'm not tainted!
The healing spells are slowly putting you back to health, but the scourge of Asuryan remains, marking your skin, weighing on your troubled soul.
How could this happen?
[From.GetTitledFirstName] tried to pass through the Flames of Asuryan, but the God saw his wickedness and burned him, leaving nothing but a blackened carcass in his wake.
A false king has been revealed by the righteous gods!
Why did he even cross the fire in the first place?
Your [GetFromRelation] was burned by the holy Flames of Asuryan, dying a horrible death and disgracing his whole bloodline.
But I'm not tainted!
You've been chosen by the Dragon Princes to take the lead of Ulthuan, following the disgraceful reign of [From.GetFirstName].
I will rule in the grace of Asuryan.
Renounce Cadai
Asuryan has cursed you, is it really worth it to worship a God who despises your rule?
Following in the footsteps of the blasphemous Witch-King, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has renounced Asuryan to follow Kaela Mensha Khaine, planting the seeds for a potential second Sundering.
He is right!
Shame befalls him.
The Dragon Princes have decided that it is in the best interest of Ulthuan that its rule pass to [From.GetFirstName] after the ignominious departure of the last Phoenix King.
Some Elves believe the Asur should detach themselves from the corruption of the outside world, others that it is their duty to lead lesser species away from evil.
We need to protect Ulthuan.
We need to protect the World.
Take a political stance
Every Elf in Ulthuan has their personal opinion about whether Asur should involve themselves in the affairs of the outside world or not. What's yours?
Isolationists
Isolationists

It is common in Ulthuan for Elves to preach detachment from the rest of the world, to prevent corruption from pouring in. Going against this traditional way of thinking is not well regarded by some Princes.
Demand liege to close borders
Ulthuan should not meddle with other lesser cultures. It is time for the Phoenix King to accept that.

I am afraid the Faction I represent must insist on changing the current political stance of Ulthuan regarding the outside world. We are fully prepared to take up arms should you refuse, and rest assured, we have warriors enough to enforce our just demand and finally guarantee the safety and purity of the blood of Asur...

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Very well.
This is not what I command!

Your shameful attempt at blackmail has not succeeded. No matter how many corrupted souls you have enticed to help carry out your plan I will not give in without a fight. Ulthuan has been secluded for far too long!

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Then war it is!

I see the error of my ways and understand now what is best for the Asur. I will issue a formal declaration disallowing further interaction with the outside world.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Excellent.

Rather than letting civil war tear the realm apart, [From.GetTitledName] has agreed to change [From.GetHerHis] stance on external politics. Your valuable support in this conflict will not be forgotten.

Sincerely,
[FromFrom.GetTitledName]
Good.
[From.GetTitledName] has agreed to the demands of the Isolationist Party.
I see...
§Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to close the borders of Ulthuan
Change Isolationist Policy
$ORDER$$SECOND_ADJ$ Civil War to change isolationist policy
Interventionists
Interventionists
Some in Ulthuan agree it is the sacred duty of the Asur, as the superior race, to act as guardians and protectors to the lesser races, and keep the world safe from corruption.
Demand liege to open borders
Ulthuan should not cower away from the world, hopelessly leaving the other races to their own limited means. It is time for the Phoenix King to accept that.

I am afraid the Faction I represent must insist on changing the current political stance of Ulthuan regarding the outside world. We are fully prepared to take up arms should you refuse, and rest assured, we have warriors enough to enforce our just demand and finally lead Ulthuan beyond of this obnoxious stagnation.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Very well.
This is not what I command!

Your shameful attempt at blackmail has not succeeded. No matter how many corrupted souls you have enticed to help carry out your plan I will not give in without a fight. Ulthuan needs not to meddle in the affairs of shortlived barbarians!

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Then war it is!

I see the error of my ways and understand now what is best for the Asur. I will issue a formal declaration allowing interactions with the outside world.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Excellent.

Rather than letting civil war tear the realm apart, [From.GetTitledName] has agreed to change [From.GetHerHis] stance on external politics. Your valuable support in this conflict will not be forgotten.

Sincerely,
[FromFrom.GetTitledName]
Good.
[From.GetTitledName] has agreed to the demands of the Interventionist Party.
I see...
Change political stand
As Phoenix King, you are allowed to switch the foreign policy of Ulthuan depending on your preference.
Ulthuan no longer recognizes the pleas of the outside world, giving paramount importance to the prosperity of the Asur over all.
Ok.
Ulthuan recognizes its role as the sole protector of the whole world.
Ok.

§Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to colonize new lands outside of Ulthuan, ridding them of corrupt or otherwise barbaric influences. Colonies increase Elven influence over the world, but can be expensive to maintain.
Asur Colonization of [Title.GetBaseName]
$ORDER$$SECOND_ADJ$ Elven Colonization of $OTHER_TITLE$
Now that the land has been freed from uncivilized indigenous barbarians, it can be assigned to a proper well-bred elven legate who will oversee its colonization.
Excellent.
Donation to Ulthuan
This colony has recently given tribute to Ulthuan.
Funded Colony
Abandoned Colony
Paid for Colony
Colonial Tribute
Withheld Tribute
Asked Assistance
§Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to expand the Asur's influence in foreign lands, ridding them of corrupt or otherwise barbaric influences.
Asur Colonization of [Title.GetBaseName]
$ORDER$$SECOND_ADJ$ Elven Colonization of $OTHER_TITLE$
The appointed ruler of your newly acquired land abroad has sent word that [From.GetSheHe] needs funds to start the project of colonization.
I will pay for it myself.
All the Princes of Ulthuan should contribute.
We cannot spare the resources.
As is customary, the Phoenix King has sent troops and resources to help start up the colonization process.
Excellent.
The Phoenix King has issued a special tax to fund the effort of Asur colonization abroad.
I'll gladly pay it.
Unspeakable waste!
Sadly, Ulthuan cannot spare resources to forward to your colony right now.
Did they abandon us?
One of your colonies has reported a great victory for the Asur. As customary, they've sent a tribute containing a share of their spoils.
I'll take them.
All the Princes of Ulthuan who supported them should take a share.
News has reached you one of Ulthuan's colonies reported a great victory. Even so, the Phoenix King withheld any profits of this success from the Dragon Princes.
How dare [From.GetSheHe]!
News has reached you one of Ulthuan's colonies reported a great victory. The Phoenix King has sent part of the profits to all those who supported Elven intervention outside Ulthuan.
Sublime.
I suppose it's fair...
[From.GetTitledFirstName], owner of one of your colonies, has sent a large tribute to Ulthuan to confirm [From.GetHerHis] staunch dedication to the Crown.
We graciously accept this tribute for ourselves.
We shall share this tribute with all the Princes who support us.
News has reached you one of Ulthuan's colonies sent a large tribute to Ulthuan, but the Phoenix King seems to have withheld it all for [From.GetHerHim]self.
How dare [From.GetSheHe]!
News has reached you one of Ulthuan's colonies reported a great victory. The Phoenix King has sent part of the profits to all those who supported Elven intervention outside Ulthuan.
Sublime.
I suppose it's fair...
Donate to Ulthuan
Give a share of your profits to the ancestral homeland, so that the Phoenix King may look kindly upon you in your time of need.
Colonial War
Helped Colony
[From.GetTitledFirstName] sends a call for help to Ulthuan, for the Phoenix King to aid [From.GetHerHis] colony in its time of need.
Ulthuan will join our brethren and fight alongside them!
I will fund the colony's effort on my own.
All the Princes shall provide help for our brethren abroad.
We cannot spare any resources right now.
Ulthuan has answered your call for help, sending resources and soldiers to aid you in your time of need.
Excellent.
One of Ulthuan's colonies is entangled in a war with an uncivilized race. The Phoenix King has issued a special tax to help it in its struggle.
I'll gladly pay it.
Unspeakable waste!
The Phoenix King has decided it is not in the best interests of the Asur to aid you right now.
Did they abandon us?
One of Ulthuan's colonies is entangled in a war with an uncivilized race. The Phoenix King has declared to mobilize the entire Kingdom to help them.
Let us march with them!
Outrageous!
Quell your fears, for the Phoenix King has heard your call and all of Ulthuan shall come to aid you against your enemies.
Praise the Gods!
Call Ulthuan
As an Asuryan colony, you can plead the Phoenix King for help in any war against barbarians you find yourself entangled in.
Enforced Policy

A princely coalition has recently forced the Phoenix King to change Ulthuan's foreign policy. It would be unlikely for any noble to touch the issue for a while, for fear of destabilizing Ulthuan too much.
Help Colony
You can assist your brethren abroad by joining in their struggles against lesser race.
An Ulthuan Prince has decided to join your wars.
Excellent.
Ignored Colony
Forced Policy
Plea to Ulthuan
Ulthuan's borders are currently closed. A generous donation from a legitimate source could perhaps change the Phoenix King's mind?
A colony of Asur has sent a bountiful donation to Ulthuan, along with esteemed messengers pleading Ulthuan to re-open its borders to the Asur abroad.
We accept this donation with an open mind and open gates.
I'm afraid this still won't do.
Opened Borders
The messengers return with an envoy from Ulthuan: the Phoenix Prince was moved by your plea and has decided to reopen Ulthuan's shores.
Finally!
Sadly, Ulthuan does not feel the world is worth saving, despite your efforts to convince them otherwise.
What about my boatload of treasure?
Restore Everqueen
Avelorn is traditionally held by the holy Everqueen. As the Phoenix King you can force the current holder to relinquish it back to its rightful owner.

Debated

This character has recently won a fiery political debate.

[FromFrom.GetFirstName] has already voiced openly [FromFrom.GetHerHis] opinions, at odds with your own, about Ulthuan's best interest, but [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has now decided to publicly challenge you to a debate to defend your argument about foreign policy.
You'll see the reason of my arguments.
I have nothing to tell you.
[From.GetFirstName] has agreed to your challenge and will debate you with a jury of peers to determine the validity of the arguments of both parties.
I will prevail.
The coward, [From.GetFirstName], has chosen to dismiss your arguments without a proper comeback and is refusing to debate you.
Of course, [From.GetSheHe] knows [From.GetSheHe]'s wrong.

The noble and a very select crowd of Asur reunites in the public square to hear your case against interventionist policies and the comeback of your opponent. You spend hours going back and forth, going through hot topics and exchanging sharp questions about Ulthuan's future. In the end your opponent starts faltering, you press the validity of your position, putting forth arguments over the Sundering and on the ungratefulness of the lesser races. Both the crowd and your opponent finally recognize your stance as the more logical.

You spend hours going back and forth, going through hot topics and exchanging sharp questions about Ulthuan's future. In the end your opponent starts faltering, you press the validity of your position, putting forth arguments over the growing threats in the North and the burden of the High Elf. Both the crowd and your opponent finally recognize your stance as the more logical.

In the end your opponent starts faltering, you press the validity of your position, putting forth arguments over the growing threats in the North and the burden of the High Elf. Both the crowd and your opponent finally recognize your stance as the more logical.
The truth prevails.

The noble and a very select crowd of Asur reunites in the public square to hear your case against interventionist policies and the comeback of your opponent. You spend hours going back and forth, going through hot topics and exchanging sharp questions about Ulthuan's future. Yet, in the end, you start seeing the validity of many points made by your adversary. You have no arguments left to counter your opponent's and are forced to agree Ulthuan would benefit from closing its borders to the lesser races.

The noble and a very select crowd of Asur reunites in the public square to hear your case against isolationist policies and the comeback of your opponent. You spend hours going back and forth, going through hot topics and exchanging sharp questions about Ulthuan's future.  Yet, in the end, you start seeing the validity of many points made by your adversary. You have no arguments left to counter your opponent's and are forced to agree Ulthuan would benefit from being more invested in the outside world.
Was I wrong all along?

The noble and a very select crowd of Asur reunites in the public square to hear your case against interventionist policies and the comeback of your opponent. You spend hours going back and forth, going through hot topics and exchanging sharp questions about Ulthuan's future. The sun goes down, some in the public start to go back to their homes, yet no consensus has been reached. By the time dawn comes, the only thing you and your opponent can agree on is how much you despise each other.

The sun goes down, some in the public start to go back to their homes, yet no consensus has been reached. By the time dawn comes, the only thing you and your opponent can agree on is how much you despise each other.
How can you be SO stubborn!?!
Has not recently debated
Debate
Asur nobles are used to endlessly debating over the vital role Ulthuan should have in the grand scheme of things.
Has not recently won a debate
Public Debate
Refused Debate Result
This character was soundly defeated in a public debate but, rather than accepting defeat, clung irrationally to their beliefs.
No, I can't be wrong! You lie!
Despite being soundly defeated, your opponent still refuses to accept the reality of Ulthuan.
Pathetic...
Pretenders!

You've always prized your impeccable poetic skills. Yet, as of late, you've had more and more trouble with inspiration. It's so hard to think of something meaningful any more, it seems like all the greatest, most sublime topics have already been exhausted by Ulthuan's long list of esteemed composers.

You've always prized your impeccable poetic skills. Yet, as of late, you've had more and more trouble with inspiration. The dreaded fear and cold sophistication of Druchii architecture and the damp forests of Naggaroth can only be applied for so long after all...
Maybe I could try taking... something... to enhance my point of view?
It is said suffering helps the poet...
I'm sure I'll find something, eventually.

It's not easy to find certain philtres in Ulthuan, but alchemists have to use all sorts of reagents for their experiments. In the end you were able to find and make use of what you needed. The thrill itself was enough to tingle your senses, but the experience right after was something indescribable.

The New World is filled with strange plants and fungi used for certain rituals, it didn't take long for you to find what you needed. In the end you were able to find and make use of what you needed. The thrill itself was enough to tingle your senses, but the experience right after was something indescribable.
I can touch the Winds of Magic!

You spend sometime wondering the moral ramifications of your action, but in the end, you agree with yourself it can be an enriching experience. As you observe life slowly dripping away from your wrists, you experience an unfathomable new sensation. When you finally press the wound closed, what you've lost in blood, you've gained tenfold in inspiration.

It's not something unheard of amongst Khaine followers after all. As you observe life slowly dripping away from your wrists, you experience an unfathomable new sensation. When you finally press the wound closed, what you've lost in blood, you've gained tenfold in inspiration.
What if I used it instead of ink? How deep!

You can see the hordes of daemonic hordes riding over your fingers. They are so distinct... Yet they're fading away already, you need more of the substance. You can't come unprepared when they come back.
They're still on my hand!
You could have touched the heavenly figure, it was right in front of you, so alluring... Yet now she has disappeared, you need more of the substance. Reality has become so dull.
Where's my dust?
You pick a fruit from the heavenly garden, yet, when put it between your lips it turns into your finger. The effects are fading again, you need more of the substance. Reality has become so dull.
Where did I leave it?
Your multiple experiences really opened your mind, you can see things in such a broad spectrum. As long as you take more of the substance.
Yes, yes, I see all now.
It took you a while to notice, but as got out of your drug-induced trance, you glanced at the servant peeling from the curtains, spying on you.
He can join me, there's enough of it for two.
Want to see something? *Grab him*
Maybe it's time to stop with this...

The servant appears scared at first, but once you force him to inhale some of your ailment, he calms himself, happily joining you. The experience is even better with someone else, maybe you should convince more people to join in the future...
Yes, just let your mind roam...
[Root.GetFirstName] unlocked the targeted decision 'Twist'.
You drag the servant across the floor and press his face into your last bag of dust, leaving him shaking and choking. After some time, he finally stops, dead.
How do you like that? What is your *soul* seeing?

Each day you give thanks for the inspiration that has led you thus far but although you still feel the thrill when pain dances across your flesh, as time goes on you long to feel something even harsher. As you wonder this things, you find yourself soothed by the chirping of a lovely songbird scampering near your window. For a while you simply delight in its song but eventually your thoughts begin to turn and you start to wonder if perhaps you could inspire it to even greater heights of artistry. How much more beautiful and moving would it be if he went to the same suffering as you subordinate yourself to...
I must know!
That's base, I'll cleanse this thought from my flesh!
That's enough, never again.

It's growing faint so quickly, but you cannot deny the unique and sublime tone given to birds' notes. It might have been its last song, but you're brought to tears by that very perfection you helped it reach.
It was... enchanting...

You start punishing your own flesh, but as you go on, you start seeing the art of your work, the passion inside every cut. You quickly grab a mirror and start drawing red lines over your face, ecstatic at the sight of your coming masterpiece.
Sublime!

Your scholarly studies give you plenty of time for peaceful contemplation and the enjoyment of solitude. All alone in the great library, you cannot fail to think of the books as little universes, hanging to your whims, depending on your care.
A slight change here or there, and history itself is rewritten!
Like the world, they could have little daemons roaming inside...
They should always be preserved at their best.
You smirk, complimenting yourself on your work and passing to the next volume. So many great deeds were committed by your ancestors you didn't know about...
It's like bending time itself!

Another little miniature is ready and you move to look for a good spot for the next one. They are so well hidden. The future generations will look at the marvels of these pages and ignore the obscenities laughing at them from the paper.
It's so delightful!

Your days of quiet enjoyment seems to have come to an end. A young apprentice has come to the library to study. A pompous, nagging little brat, asking you for directions every hour, giving you sleazy looks every time he thinks you're not watching him.

Your days of quiet enjoyment seems to have come to an end. A young apprentice has come to the library to study. A pretentious, nagging little brat, asking you for directions every hour, outrageously flirting as if her very presence was a gift to you.
It's a vast and ancient library one could easily get lost in...
Let's see if the brat can really handle what it craves for...
Walking close to the staircase, I see? Hmm...
I'll just have to bear with it.

Who knows when the poor student is getting out of the old storage room. It's so dark and twisted, how could the brat even end there, you wonder? Here's to hoping the poor soul doesn't get eaten by rats. On the other hand, his muffled screams for help are so soothing...
It sounds like a lullaby.

It wasn't so bad. The boy turned out to be experienced at least in something. And going rough with him assured you some days of quiet in the future. You couldn't deny you enjoyed having the chance to choke the little brat, if only for a while.

It wasn't so bad. The girl turned out to be experienced at least in something. And going rough with her assured you some days of quiet in the future. You couldn't deny you enjoyed having the chance to choke the little brat, if only for a while.
A teacher *should* spank their students from time to time...
It takes just one little trip. You have to bear the squealing voice of the annoying twerp only up to when the brat's head squashes on the floor below.
What a beautiful silence. Poetic.

You were doing some testing for a new concoction in your laboratory, but something has gone wrong. The rat you used for your experiment has started to slowly and painfully choke after tasting the substance.
This needs to be closely observed, yes...
I'll check on it later, let's try something else first.
Better to end the poor creature's suffering.

Despite your careful examination, you cannot find the source of the problem. You have to admit to yourself though, watching the creature gasping for its last breath from above, like a passive deity, filled you with a smug sense of satisfaction.
It just comes with the job.

When you return with a new mix, you find out the rat has not yet drawn its last breath. You have it ingest the new substance and while the creature dies, there's a series of fascinating side-effects accompanying its death.
How interesting. I'll need another rat.

You really looked forward the visit of your distant colleague, you'd had a thrilling correspondence in the last months. Yet, now that you have him here, you are starting to seriously question your judgement. The short-sighted fool is dismissing many of your accomplishments, accusing you of using experiments just as a pretence to kill and torture your test subjects. He has even started to threaten you to call authorities to have you answer of some of these supposed transgressions.
Your brain doesn't work. Let me check it.
Allow me then to show you this great brew I tested on rats some time ago...
Maybe he's right?

Your colleague finally stops twitching. Some more stitches and he'll be free to go. Of course he was belittling you, the lymph determining his pride and envy were cluttering his brain, you had to remove an entire piece to cure him.
Ssshhh, it's all over now.

There's no real difference. Like the rat, the scholar can only look at you from below now, in awe and terror, as he chokes on his own blood. The post-mortem reactions seem to be considerably different from your last tests with rats.
I should try it with more people then...

Since your youth you've been admired for your intelligence. Yet, at the same time, when you've put it into practice, you've always had people complain and snort, opting for the most stupid of decisions. Like the minor noble in front of you right now, bragging about his mediocre accomplishments and calling your wisdom cowardice and self-entitlement. Why gifted people such as you should suffer idiots of his sort?
If you so desire, I'll humiliate you right now in front of everyone.
Speak on, I'll speak later, to the right people.
If I answered in kind, I'd be as stupid as he is.

When you're finished with him, the courtier is so ashamed he cannot spit a word back. As if it wasn't enough recounting his many failings, you inflame the court against him and he's soon driven out by shouts and threats.
See?

Seeing you not answering him, the courtier keeps on bragging, finally leaving the room when satisfied with his work. In a few days you send your people to the countryside, spreading enough vicious rumours to utterly destroy his reputation, while at the same time maintaining yours.
That's where the genius lies.

The events at court in the last weeks still haunt you. The thrill, the satisfaction of having the entire court hanging from your lips, then pitted against that insufferable idiot... It wouldn't be bad to feel it again.
There's plenty of fools, it's only a question of time.
No, it's not warranted.

You are about to send another peasant off to his ironic and well fitted punishment, when one of your spies comes whispering into your ears the bragging courtier is dead by his own hand. He committed suicide to escape the shame.
Ah! Thus proving once more what a fool he was!

You've always had a sweet tooth and enjoyed foods of all sorts, filling your belly with exotic delicacies gives you an indescribable sense of satisfaction. Yet many at court frown on your taste as inappropriate for an Elven noblewoman.
